<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RIDE-HAILING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/29/re-off?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
And...We're Off
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It may not be in your Siri Suggestions. Or even on your phone’s front page. But today, when Lyft goes public, it’ll at long last <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-lyft-survived-a-cutthroat-money-raising-battle-with-uber-11553776934?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overshadow</a> perpetual rival Uber by hitting the public markets first.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lyft is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/lyft-ipo-puts-uber-in-the-back-seat-for-once?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set to IPO</a> at a value of about $24 billion, making it the fifth-largest public offering since the financial crisis, and second only to Facebook’s 2012 offering among U.S. tech startups. Uber’s IPO? Still in the paperwork phase.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s run the numbers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Rides are good. </strong>Lyft gave 18.6 million people at least one ride in Q4, up from 6.6 million in late 2016. It has a 39% share of the U.S. ride-hailing market, up from 22% in 2016.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But losses are worse.</strong> Total costs and expenses hit $3.1 billion in 2018, up 77% annually. And Lyft reported a loss of $911 million last year, which grew from $688 million a year earlier.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That means Lyft will have </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/lyfts-ipo-to-test-investors-appetite-for-money-losing-startups-11553515201?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lost more</a></span><span> than any other U.S. startup in the 12 months leading up to its IPO, per S&P Global Market Intelligence.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Lyft’s (<a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/lyft-to-price-shares-above-targeted-range-of-62-to-68-in-ipo-2019-03-26-141033730?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">standing-room only</a>) pitch is about trimming costs. And it’s highlighting that while losses are growing...you should see its revenue. The company reported sales that more than doubled last year to $2.16 billion.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Lyft is changing the tides</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For years, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/24/business/dealbook/lyft-ipo-cheat-sheet.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stakes</a> in some of this country’s most successful startups have been open only to the VC crowd. When Lyft <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/lyft-to-price-shares-above-targeted-range-of-62-to-68-in-ipo-11553614735?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lists shares</a> on the Nasdaq today, it’ll open the floodgates to anyone with disposable income and opposable thumbs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And more high-value tech firms could follow. </strong>Uber, Slack, Pinterest, and Postmates have all filed SEC docs. Palantir, Airbnb, and Peloton could do the same later this year. Many expect 2019 to be the biggest year on record by dollars raised.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/29/tim-sloan-starts-condo-search?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tim Sloan Starts His Condo Search
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tim Sloan is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/28/wells-fargo-ceo-tim-sloan-retiring.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retiring</a> from his post as CEO of Wells Fargo. As a proper send-off, the bank’s shares jumped nearly 3% after hours yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sloan took the CEO job in October 2016, tasked with cleaning up a number of scandals at Wells Fargo that were only just crescendoing. It started with employees opening millions of potentially fake accounts to meet sales goals, but the “<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/wells-fargos-latest-high-wire-act/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pattern of consumer abuses</a>,” as D.C. lawmakers called it a few weeks back, continued from there.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sloan’s retirement comes as a surprise </strong>(a welcome one for <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-22/warren-says-wells-fargo-must-fire-ceo-before-fed-ends-growth-cap?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sen. Elizabeth Warren</a>, likely an unwelcome one for <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/video/2019/03/28/buffett-wells-fargo-ceo-tim-sloan-has-my-support.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Warren Buffett</a>).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This month, Wells Fargo disclosed that Sloan received a 5% raise to $18.4 million in 2018.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And when reports surfaced that the bank was shopping for a new CEO at Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo issued strong reports that the board had Sloan’s back.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>C. Allen Parker, the bank's general counsel, will become interim CEO (C. EO?). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>Morgan Stanley’s No. 2 is also <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/28/morgan-stanleys-no-2-colm-kelleher-to-retire-according-to-memo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retiring</a>. COO Colm Kelleher will leave MS this summer after 30 years at the bank.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELECOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/29/1-800-okay-re-definitely-not-human?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
1-800-Okay You're Definitely Not a Human
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wouldn’t be all that surprising if Google’s most-searched term this week was “robocalls.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1) Verizon said it will help users block robocalls</strong>...for a price. The biggest cell phone carrier in the U.S. has a new Call Filter app that offers “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/verizon-will-help-you-block-robocalls-for-an-extra-3-a-month?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">enhanced call protection</a>” for $2.99/month, as well as a free lower-tier service.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2) The Federal Communications Commission has some calls to make itself. </strong>Telecom watchdogs in the U.S. have <em>levied</em> financial penalties of $208.4 million against robocalling violators since 2015. The trouble is in the <em>follow through</em>. So far, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-fcc-has-fined-robocallers-208-million-its-collected-6-790-11553770803?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>, they've collected $6,790.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Reminds us of the <em>Seinfeld </em>joke: </strong></span><span>They know how to </span><span><em>take </em></span><span>the reservation...but not how to </span><span><em>hold </em></span><span>the reservation.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3) The Federal Trade Commission might have better luck.</strong> It <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/ftc-fines-operations-responsible-for-billions-of-illegal-robocalls/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> this week that it reached settlements (complete with fines of up to $3 million) with four operations responsible for billions of illegal robocalls. FYI, analysts predicted last fall that nearly half of all mobile calls this year would be scams.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/29/collapsed-airlines-make-go-wow?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Collapsed Airlines That Make You Go...WOW
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/udmx3pgdiD7tm/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facing insurmountable financial odds, Iceland’s WOW Air <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/28/business/wow-air-scli-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collapsed</a>, canceled all flights, and left thousands of passengers stranded across two continents. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WOW is (was?) a low-cost, privately held airline known for zooming you across the Atlantic for less than a night out in Reykjavík.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The airline had been working to secure its long-term financial future for several months.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>After a potential investor pulled out of a deal, WOW said it was in talks to be bought by rival Icelandair earlier this week...but the deal never came through, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c4cc98d8-4c20-11e9-bbc9-6917dce3dc62?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the FT</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The collapse shows that financial sustainability </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/0b7441c990ad4bd5a15107a3ca97e3cd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remains tough</a></span><span> for budget airlines. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yesterday was the most Monday Thursday ever for WOW travelers. </strong>The airline advised passengers with scheduled flights to seek “rescue fares” from other airlines, or request refunds through their credit card companies or travel insurance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So...Twitter did what Twitter does best: absolutely <em>drag</em> the company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1553793972.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Via <a href="https://twitter.com/jackielaff1/status/1111251687396638720?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@jackielaff1</a></em></sup></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/29/s-not-raven?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
That’s Not So Raven
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Economists like making predictions. They’re constantly using the yield curve, stock prices, even <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lipstick_index?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lipstick</a> to forecast the vicissitudes (impressed?) of the global economy. But...what if they’re not any good at it?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow Bloomberg here. </strong>Of the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/economists-are-actually-terrible-at-forecasting-recessions?srnd=businessweek-v2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">469 downturns</a> since 1988, the International Monetary Fund predicted four (4) in the spring of the preceding year, economist Andrew Bridgen found.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1553803632.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Via </em><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/economists-are-actually-terrible-at-forecasting-recessions?srnd=businessweek-v2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Bloomberg</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So when we tell you: </strong>The National Association for Business Economics found 42% of its members predict a U.S. recession beginning next year, 10% this year, and 25% in 2021...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember that the IMF isn’t the only group of economists with a losing record. A recent <a href="https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/WP/Issues/2018/03/05/How-Well-Do-Economists-Forecast-Recessions-45672?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working paper</a> found that of the 153 recessions in 63 countries from 1992-2014, only five (5) were predicted by a consensus of private sector economists in the spring of the preceding year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Economists can keep trying, but there’s only one person we trust to predict the future. Someone get Gregg on the line. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F03%2F29%2Fs-not-raven" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/29/don-t-quiz-tell?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Don’t Quiz and Tell
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More clairvoyant than Gregg. Cozier than the FAA and Boeing. Looking for more awesome writers (seriously, <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we’re hiring</a>). It’s the Brew’s weekly news quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Apple had its big “services” event on Monday.</strong> How many of the new/revamped products can you name?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. What company am I? </strong>1) I’m based in Dubai 2) I refer to my drivers as “captains” and 3) I agreed to be acquired by Uber this week for $3.1 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. A vote to legalize recreational marijuana</strong> in which state was called off this week? (This is its state house, btw.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1553793361.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">4. We’ll name a country.</strong> You have to decide whether it’s Scandinavian, Nordic, Baltic, or a combo.</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Iceland</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Denmark</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Estonia</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sweden  </span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">5. How do you pronounce “gif,” </strong>according to Dictionary.com?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1) Apple TV+, Apple TV Channels, Apple Card, Apple News+, Apple Arcade 2) Careem 3) New Jersey 4) Iceland = Nordic, Denmark = Scandinavian & Nordic, Estonia = Baltic, Sweden = Scandinavian & Nordic 5) With a soft “g” </em></sup></p>

Or even on your phone’s front page. But today, when Lyft goes public, it’ll at long last \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-lyft-survived-a-cutthroat-money-raising-battle-with-uber-11553776934?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eovershadow\u003c/a\u003e perpetual rival Uber by hitting the public markets first.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLyft is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/lyft-ipo-puts-uber-in-the-back-seat-for-once?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset to IPO\u003c/a\u003e at a value of about $24 billion, making it the fifth-largest public offering since the financial crisis, and second only to Facebook’s 2012 offering among U.S. tech startups. Uber’s IPO? Still in the paperwork phase.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s run the numbers\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRides are good. \u003c/strong\u003eLyft gave 18.6 million people at least one ride in Q4, up from 6.6 million in late 2016. It has a 39% share of the U.S. ride-hailing market, up from 22% in 2016.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut losses are worse.\u003c/strong\u003e Total costs and expenses hit $3.1 billion in 2018, up 77% annually. And Lyft reported a loss of $911 million last year, which grew from $688 million a year earlier.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat means Lyft will have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/lyfts-ipo-to-test-investors-appetite-for-money-losing-startups-11553515201?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elost more\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e than any other U.S. startup in the 12 months leading up to its IPO, per S\u0026P Global Market Intelligence.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Lyft’s (\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/lyft-to-price-shares-above-targeted-range-of-62-to-68-in-ipo-2019-03-26-141033730?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estanding-room only\u003c/a\u003e) pitch is about trimming costs. And it’s highlighting that while losses are growing...you should see its revenue. The company reported sales that more than doubled last year to $2.16 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLyft is changing the tides\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor years, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/24/business/dealbook/lyft-ipo-cheat-sheet.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estakes\u003c/a\u003e in some of this country’s most successful startups have been open only to the VC crowd. When Lyft \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/lyft-to-price-shares-above-targeted-range-of-62-to-68-in-ipo-11553614735?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elists shares\u003c/a\u003e on the Nasdaq today, it’ll open the floodgates to anyone with disposable income and opposable thumbs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd more high-value tech firms could follow. \u003c/strong\u003eUber, Slack, Pinterest, and Postmates have all filed SEC docs. Palantir, Airbnb, and Peloton could do the same later this year. Many expect 2019 to be the biggest year on record by dollars raised.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTim Sloan is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/28/wells-fargo-ceo-tim-sloan-retiring.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretiring\u003c/a\u003e from his post as CEO of Wells Fargo. As a proper send-off, the bank’s shares jumped nearly 3% after hours yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSloan took the CEO job in October 2016, tasked with cleaning up a number of scandals at Wells Fargo that were only just crescendoing. It started with employees opening millions of potentially fake accounts to meet sales goals, but the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/wells-fargos-latest-high-wire-act/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epattern of consumer abuses\u003c/a\u003e,” as D.C. lawmakers called it a few weeks back, continued from there.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSloan’s retirement comes as a surprise \u003c/strong\u003e(a welcome one for \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-22/warren-says-wells-fargo-must-fire-ceo-before-fed-ends-growth-cap?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSen. Elizabeth Warren\u003c/a\u003e, likely an unwelcome one for \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/video/2019/03/28/buffett-wells-fargo-ceo-tim-sloan-has-my-support.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWarren Buffett\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis month, Wells Fargo disclosed that Sloan received a 5% raise to $18.4 million in 2018.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd when reports surfaced that the bank was shopping for a new CEO at Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo issued strong reports that the board had Sloan’s back.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eC. Allen Parker, the bank's general counsel, will become interim CEO (C. EO?). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eMorgan Stanley’s No. 2 is also \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/28/morgan-stanleys-no-2-colm-kelleher-to-retire-according-to-memo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretiring\u003c/a\u003e. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWouldn’t be all that surprising if Google’s most-searched term this week was “robocalls.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1) Verizon said it will help users block robocalls\u003c/strong\u003e...for a price. The biggest cell phone carrier in the U.S. has a new Call Filter app that offers “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/verizon-will-help-you-block-robocalls-for-an-extra-3-a-month?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenhanced call protection\u003c/a\u003e” for $2.99/month, as well as a free lower-tier service.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2) The Federal Communications Commission has some calls to make itself. \u003c/strong\u003eTelecom watchdogs in the U.S. have \u003cem\u003elevied\u003c/em\u003e financial penalties of $208.4 million against robocalling violators since 2015. The trouble is in the \u003cem\u003efollow through\u003c/em\u003e. So far, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-fcc-has-fined-robocallers-208-million-its-collected-6-790-11553770803?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e, they've collected $6,790.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReminds us of the \u003cem\u003eSeinfeld \u003c/em\u003ejoke: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey know how to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003etake \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe reservation...but not how to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ehold \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe reservation.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3) The Federal Trade Commission might have better luck.\u003c/strong\u003e It \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/ftc-fines-operations-responsible-for-billions-of-illegal-robocalls/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e this week that it reached settlements (complete with fines of up to $3 million) with four operations responsible for billions of illegal robocalls. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThat’s Not So Raven\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEconomists like making predictions. They’re constantly using the yield curve, stock prices, even \u003ca href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lipstick_index?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elipstick\u003c/a\u003e to forecast the vicissitudes (impressed?) of the global economy. But...what if they’re not any good at it?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFollow Bloomberg here. \u003c/strong\u003eOf the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/economists-are-actually-terrible-at-forecasting-recessions?srnd=businessweek-v2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e469 downturns\u003c/a\u003e since 1988, the International Monetary Fund predicted four (4) in the spring of the preceding year, economist Andrew Bridgen found.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1553803632.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"540\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eVia \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-28/economists-are-actually-terrible-at-forecasting-recessions?srnd=businessweek-v2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBloomberg\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo when we tell you: \u003c/strong\u003eThe National Association for Business Economics found 42% of its members predict a U.S. recession beginning next year, 10% this year, and 25% in 2021...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemember that the IMF isn’t the only group of economists with a losing record. A recent \u003ca href=\"https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/WP/Issues/2018/03/05/How-Well-Do-Economists-Forecast-Recessions-45672?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworking paper\u003c/a\u003e found that of the 153 recessions in 63 countries from 1992-2014, only five (5) were predicted by a consensus of private sector economists in the spring of the preceding year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eEconomists can keep trying, but there’s only one person we trust to predict the future. Someone get Gregg on the line. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F03%2F29%2Fs-not-raven\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 25px\" width=\"25\" src=\"https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Let%27s+get+Gregg+on+the+line\u0026url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/29/s-not-raven\u0026via=MorningBrew\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 25px\" width=\"25\" src=\"https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true\u0026url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F03%2F29%2Fs-not-raven\u0026title=That%E2%80%99s+Not+So+Raven\u0026source=www.morningbrew.com\u0026summary=Let%27s+get+Gregg+on+the+line\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 25px\" width=\"25\" src=\"https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!-- END SOCIAL LINKS ---\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e\u003c! Cozier than the FAA and Boeing. Looking for more awesome writers (seriously, \u003ca href=\"https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewe’re hiring\u003c/a\u003e). It’s the Brew’s weekly news quiz.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Apple had its big “services” event on Monday.\u003c/strong\u003e How many of the new/revamped products can you name?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. What company am I? \u003c/strong\u003e1) I’m based in Dubai 2) I refer to my drivers as “captains” and 3) I agreed to be acquired by Uber this week for $3.1 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. A vote to legalize recreational marijuana\u003c/strong\u003e in which state was called off this week? (This is its state house, btw.)\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1553793361.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"540\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e4. We’ll name a country.\u003c/strong\u003e You have to decide whether it’s Scandinavian, Nordic, Baltic, or a combo.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col style=\"list-style-type: lower-alpha;\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIceland\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDenmark\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEstonia\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSweden  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e5. How do you pronounce “gif,” \u003c/strong\u003eaccording to Dictionary.com?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAnswers: \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003e1) Apple TV+, Apple TV Channels, Apple Card, Apple News+, Apple Arcade 2) Careem 3) New Jersey 4) Iceland = Nordic, Denmark = Scandinavian \u0026 Nordic, Estonia = Baltic, Sweden = Scandinavian \u0026 Nordic 5) With a soft “g” \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F03%2F29%2Fdon-t-quiz-tell\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
